metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14647 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Python's elementtree C accelerator failed to initialise Expat's hash salt during initialization. This could make it easy to conduct denial of service attacks against Expat by constructing an XML document that would cause pathological hash collisions in Expat's internal data structures, consuming large amounts CPU and RAM. The vulnerability exists in Python versions 3.7.0, 3.6.0 through 3.6.6, 3.5.0 through 3.5.6, 3.4.0 through 3.4.9, 2.7.0 through 2.7.15.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14647` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.15~rc1-1ubuntu0.1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.15~rc1-1ubuntu0.1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.15~rc1-1ubuntu0.1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.15~rc1-1ubuntu0.1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.15~rc1-1ubuntu0.1
python2.7 - 2.7.15~rc1-1ubuntu0.1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.15~rc1-1ubuntu0.1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.15~rc1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.7-1~18.04
libpython3.6 - 3.6.7-1~18.04
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.7-1~18.04
libpython3.6-stdlib - 3.6.7-1~18.04
libpython3.6-testsuite - 3.6.7-1~18.04
python3.6 - 3.6.7-1~18.04
python3.6-examples - 3.6.7-1~18.04
python3.6-minimal - 3.6.7-1~18.04
python3.6-venv - 3.6.7-1~18.04
No subscription required

idle-python3.7 - 3.7.1-1~18.04
libpython3.7 - 3.7.1-1~18.04
libpython3.7-minimal - 3.7.1-1~18.04
libpython3.7-stdlib - 3.7.1-1~18.04
libpython3.7-testsuite - 3.7.1-1~18.04
python3.7 - 3.7.1-1~18.04
python3.7-examples - 3.7.1-1~18.04
python3.7-minimal - 3.7.1-1~18.04
python3.7-venv - 3.7.1-1~18.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.15~rc1-1ubuntu0.1').
python3.6 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.7-1~18.04').
python3.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.7.1-1~18.04').
